reviews.review: Dead by Daylight is probably one of my favorite games. I have around 230 hours of play time. Several friends and I got Dead by Daylight when it was on sale, and initially it was spooky. We failed tons of skill checks and we got rolled. After we leveled up and played more, along with learning each killer, we started to get better. I really enjoy playing with friends, and when people aren't on I play as killer. Each game is different because every killer has their own play-style and perk builds. Similarly, playing as killer is always different because survivors all have their own perk builds, and play-styles. You win some games, you lose some games, sometimes you win big, or lose big, but it's fun. I have purchased a lot of DLC and will probably buy more. You can also unlock perks, killers, and survivors with shards (a currency gained for leveling up), although it takes some time. Overall, it's a fun game, and playing with friends is fun too.

This game is honestly really good and if I didn't have to restart i definitely would've put way more hours into the steam version. When I first played this game on PS4 I found it incredibly hard to get into for many reasons: lot of stuff to learn, lack of voice chat in-game and questionable random teammates, lack of dedicated servers (fixed later on), and killer felt too strong. Luckily I had friends to play with and I had a blast and learned a lot, it wasn't easy at first but 2 months in I was starting to hit rank 7 (out of 20). As long as you have the patience to learn or friends to play with (if you play survivor) im sure you will enjoy this game.

In the past 2 years the devs have proved to me that this game has passion, and honestly it remains highly respected from me to this day for that reason. Many games lack passion, but this one is a solid exception. SO MUCH content has been added in the past 2 years, and there will be more to come. This game will always be installed in my pc, and will always have a place in my heart.

MMR has made the game unplayable for anyone but 'elite' players. I've played different killers since MMR and it's an intolerable, toxic experience that used to be challenging but rewarding. If you play killer, you are matched into a lobby of survivors with an 'average' MMR against yours. Since MMR, I've generally been matched into 2 very high skilled survs and 2 potatoes. This is the worst possible way to implement MMR in a game like this which is 4 v 1.
pogshit, play it but you'll hate yourself

I've been playing or following this game essentially since it came out. Even though it started with many deficiencies, the game, its developing team and its community grew up and now it's one of the more active games in Steam. I'd say that the game in a span of a couple years has changed for the best; most of the players needs are answered gameplay (chase balance for example) and design wise (pyramid head and ghost face were very much requested since the beginning essentially).

When I recommend online multiplayer games, I don't focus on recommending them because they're good NOW, but since they have a nature of changing throughout time (for the worst or the best), I tend to recommend it based on the prospect of its continuity. And as I mentioned, based on how well it has evolved throughout time, I'd say this game was and is completely worth it, probably for at least several more years.
